intro: Paraboea takensis, commonly known as the Tawean mountain vine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments at higher elevations.
